Class Carta

java.lang.Object
Carta
public class Carta extends Object
Represents a playing card.

  • It contains information about the suit, number, value, and image path of the card.
  • It can be serialized and deserialized from XML.

  • Field Details

    • Img_path

      public String Img_path
      The path of the image of the card (which is a client side resource). TO DO: client should build the path of the card himself, using its attributes, without having to be sent the path by the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • Carta

      public Carta()
      Empty constructor.

      Constructs a new instance of the Carta class with default values.

    • Carta

      public Carta(String seme, char numero, int valore, String img_path)
      Parameterized constructor.

      Constructs a new instance of the Carta class with the specified values.

      Parameters:
      seme - The suit of the card.
      numero - The number of the card.
      valore - The value of the card.
      img_path - The path of the image of the card.

    • Carta

      public Carta(Element e)
      Parameterized constructor.

      Constructs a new instance of the Carta from an XML Element (deserialization). It is primarily used to extract cards from XML formatted messages sent by clients. Uses XMLserializer to parse the XML Element nested elements, which represent the card attributes. XMLserializer.parseTagName(Element, String)

      Parameters:
      e - The XML Element from which to extract the card.

  • Method Details

    • serialize

      public Element serialize(Document d)
      Serializes the Carta object into an Element, using a given document.

      1. First of all, it creates a Carta Element using the given Document.
      2. Then an Element for each attribute using is created, to which the corresponding value is appended in the form of a TextNode.
      3. Then, each attribute Element is appended to the Carta Element.
      4. Finally, the Carta Element is appended to the given Document.
      The caller of this function should append the returned Element to the Document he is using. It is primarily used to append cards to XML formatted messages sent to clients.

      The resulting Element will have the following structure: 

       
 <Carta>
   <seme>...</seme>
   <numero>...</numero>
   <valore>...</valore>
   <Img_path>...</Img_path>
 </Carta>
      Parameters:
      d - the Document to create the Carta Element in.
      Returns:
      the serialized Element representing the Carta object.

    • serialize

      public Document serialize() throws ParserConfigurationException
      Serializes the Carta object into a Document.

      Uses serialize(Document) to serialize the Carta object into an Element, then appends it to the created Document, which is returned. The single XML serialized card, more precisely the returned document, can be stringified and sent to the client in the form of a string, or written to a file. An example of application of this function is toXML().

      Returns:
      the serialized Document representing the Carta object.
      Throws:
      ParserConfigurationException

    • miglioreDi

      public boolean miglioreDi(Carta altraCarta, String semeBriscola, String semeDiMano)
      Compares this card with another card, returning true if, given a briscola and a hand suit, this is better than altraCarta.

      The logic with which the comparison between cards was implemented is as follows:

      • Cases of this:
        1. This has the briscola suit
          • altraCarta can win if:
            1. it has the briscola suit and a higher value
        2. This has the hand suit
          • altraCarta can win if:
            1. it has the briscola suit
            2. it has the hand suit and a higher value
        3. This has a different suit from both the briscola and the hand suit
          • altraCarta can win if:
            1. it has the briscola suit
            2. it has the hand suit
            3. it has a higher value
      Parameters:
      altraCarta - the card to compare this card with.
      semeBriscola - the briscola suit.
      semeDiMano - the hand suit (the suit of the first card played).
      Returns:
      true if this card is better than altraCarta, false otherwise.

    • toXML

      public String toXML() throws TransformerException, ParserConfigurationException
      Serializes the Carta object into a string.

      Uses serialize() to serialize the Carta object into a Document, then stringifies it using XMLserializer.stringfyNoIndent(Document). It is primarily used to directly send the serialized card to the client in the form of an XML string.

      Returns:
      the serialized string representing the Carta object.
      Throws:
      TransformerException
      ParserConfigurationException

    • getImgName

      public String getImgName()
      Only returns the name of the image of the card, excluding the rest of the path.

      Uses Paths#getFileName() to get the name of the image of the card from its path. It is primarily used to send the name of the image of the card to the client, so that the client can build the path of the image himself.

      Returns:
      the name of the image of the card.
